p: The vegetative cycle depends on climatic conditions, plant development, and cultural practices. In southern European regions, chestnut tree bud break typically occurs at the April, flowering between June and July, and fruit set and maturity from August to October ( Figure 4) [ 9]. Dormancy, i.e., the inability to initiate growth from meristems and other organs and cells, occurs between December and February [ 13, 33]. Concerning the reproductive cycle, chestnut species is monoecious at the flowering level and the female and male flowers are borne on inflorescences called catkins. Regarding inflorescence, chestnut trees are andromonoecious, because they have two types of catkins, unisexual male catkins and bisexual catkins [ 15].
